item.title: Notes on Microeconomics
item.description: Preference Utility Function Continuity Rational Choice Function Choice Revealed Preference Relation WARP (Weak Axiom of Revealed Preference) SARP (Strong Axiom of Revealed Preference) Rationalizing Choice Function Demand (Consumer Preference) Continuity (revisited) Monotonicity Convexity Special Preferences UMP (Utility Maximization Problem) Indirect Preference & Utility Differentiability Consumer Problem with Differentiable Preference EMP (Expenditure Minimizationg Problem) Dual Consumer Duality Properties Consumer Welfare Demand (Consumer Choice) Consumer Problem Demand Function WARP (revisited) Rationalizing Demand Function SARP (revisited) Types of Commodity (Compensated) Law of Demand Producer Technology Production Function PMP (Profit Maximization Problem) Law of Supply CMP (Cost Minimization Problem) Partial Equilibrium Perfect Competition (Short Run) Perfect Competition (Long Run) Monopoly Cournot (Quantity) Bertrand Duopoly (Price) Total Welfare (Partial) General Equilibrium (Exchange) Core Efficiency & Edgeworth Box Competitive Market Equilibrium Total Welfare (Exchange) General Equilibrium (Production) Production Equilibrium Total Welfare (Production) Externality (Perfect Information) Bilateral Externality Quota Taxation Bargain (Property Right) Multilateral Externality Taxation Externality (Asymmetric Information) Bargain Government Intervention Quota Taxation Public Goods Private Provision Subsidy Textbook 1: Lecture Notes in Microeconomic Theory (RBST) (~ #Producer)
